{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3542877,"name":"Matthew DeVos","username":"Glendale_Robotics","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/g/3bc359/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-27T20:30:57.124Z","cooked":"

We are a new team this year and are hoping to get help with an issue we are having.
The controls of our tank drive are inverted (the left joystick controls left and right and the right joystick controls forward and backwards) and we don’t know how to fix it.

This our code: GeminiRobotics10611

I would suggest changing which joystick is in each location in the constructor.

The Github code link has some problems.
Line 43 of RobotContainer calls for a TankDriveCommand which doesn’t exist.
Tank drive usually means the leftY stick controls the left side and the rightY stick controls the right side.
Currently the line calls for leftY and rightX.
That would be more typical of an arcade drive and sounds like your post where the leftY drives the robot forward and the rightX makes it turn. You would need to update github or post the missing TankDriveCommand file.
See Differential here Using the WPILib Classes to Drive your Robot — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation
An actual joystick would be more intuitive for an arcade drive.

Looks like TankDriveCommand is now TankDrive and its execute is calling for arcade
